result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas M Schulz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Douglas M Schulz in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Douglas M Schulz.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached an agreement. Defendant plead guilty to count #2. Upon motion of the State counts #1 and #3 are dismissed. Motion granted. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29, ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored, prohibition of child offender working with children pursuant to Sec. 948.13 and possession of body armor prohibited pursuant to Sec. 941.291. PSI ordered. Minutes filed.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Douglas M Schulz in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Douglas M Schulz.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
3:08 PM (64-06) Defendant Douglas M Schulz in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Douglas M Schulz.  Attorney Samuel Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness Jennifer Ludlum. Whitewater PD.
Jennifer Lundlum duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Berg. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the Court. Witness has identified the defendant in court. 
3:17PM Cross examination by Attorney Renz. Exhibit #2 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #2 offered and received by the court.
Argument by ADA Berg,
Argument by Attorney Renz.

Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
State is requesting a Arg. date. 

Adj. 3:26PM

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

BOND COVERS ALL FILES 22CF359, 21CF50 & 21CT48

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ANY WALMART STORES. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Douglas M Schulz in court. Warrant quashed. Prior bond to cover all files. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
